ygData.subject: Re: Re: soloing at 27
ygData.msgSnippet: I have actually started using this tactic and it s working a great deal. Very good tactic and great fun wacking the enemy in the back.   8) I shall continue to
ygData.messageBody:
I have actually started using this tactic and it's working a great deal.
Very good tactic and great fun wacking the enemy in the back. 8)
I shall continue to use this tactic although I find it hard to use in
dungeon settings as it's not possible to stop the mob from sneaking away
and getting friends to help. 8(

I was just saying that I think bellow should do a little bit more dmg as it
would be nice to have a proper DD song.

Madagan Songweaver, bard of 28 songs (Mez is fucking shit)




Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...> on 14/11/99 18:43:12

Please respond to eqbards@onelist.com

To: eqbards@onelist.com
cc: (bcc: John Senior/M&G)
Subject: [eqbards] Re: soloing at 27




From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>

> Date: Fri, 12 Nov 1999 12:03:35 +0000
> From: John_Senior@...
> Subject: RE: Bellow song Damage
>
> I being a level 27 Bard probably use Bellow more than any other song as
> that little extra dmg is great.

<snip>

> Madagan, who struggles to solo blues

If you are 27th then you are using the wrong soings to solo. I am 29th,
and i solo all the time, and i NEVER use bellow. Just yesterday, i
solo'd a Full size mammoth (blue) and a Werewolf (also blue).

The way to solo at 27+ is chain/fear/heal. chain the mob so it can't
run, Fear it so i walks away, Whack it with your weapons, and heal
during the EXTRA pulse. Mamoths can hit for 100 points a round, so with
my HP, bellowing against it i would last about 6 rounds. With
Chain/fear/heal, i was able to solo it with about 50% hp left, probably
only that bad because my brass is not maxed, and i missed notes on fear
alot.

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
with the subject lol.
